DataElement.preferredName: Grooved Pegboard Test Assessment Negation Complete Specify
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the free text field to specify why a grooved pegboard test was not completed.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Grooved Pegboard Test Assessment Negation Complete
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to an evaluation of a grooved pegboard test (a manipulative dexterity test using a pegboard device with five rows of five holes) not completed.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A manipulative dexterity test using a pegboard device wiht five rows of five holes.  It features 25 key-style pegs with holes in various positions in space, and is especially good for testing lateralized brain damage.

Concepts.definition: A manipulative dexterity test using a pegboard device with five rows of five holes. It features 25 key-style pegs with holes in various positions in space, and is especially good for testing lateralized brain damage.

Concepts.definition: The final result of a determination of the value, significance, or extent of.

To possess every necessary or normal part or component or step; having come or been brought to a conclusion.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The free text field to specify the assessment performed.
